head.title: Thorn Is Hired By the Nets

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New Jersey Nets

hedline.hl1: Thorn Is Hired By the Nets

abstract.p: Rod Thorn, National Basketball Association executive vice president for basketball operations, accepts position as president of New Jersey Nets (S)

block.p: The last two weeks have been wondrous for Lewis Katz, the principal owner of the Nets. First, he received a last-minute phone call from his son, Drew, encouraging him to change his mind about not attending the National Basketball Association draft lottery and sitting on the dais. And sure enough, with Katz representing them, the Nets received the first pick, defying 4 in 100 odds.

Then on Monday, Katz received a call from Rod Thorn, the league's executive vice president for basketball operations. Thorn, whom Katz had attempted to woo into the organization last summer, asked if the Nets had decided on a president. If they had not, Thorn said, he wanted the job. Yesterday, Thorn was announced as the Nets' president, receiving a deal that is believed to be worth about $12.5 million over five years.
